data.title: "code --reuse-window" doesn't reuse window when used as $EDITOR
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. `export EDITOR="code -r -w"`
2. Run `git commit`
3. New window will open for `COMMIT_MSG` file. Existing window is not reused.

Same thing with other Unix tools that use `$EDITOR`, such as `crontab`.

data.title: SaveAll Linux keybinding Ctrl+Alt+S minimizes VS Code on Ubuntu
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.0 insiders
- OS Version: Linux Ubuntu 14.04

We added a keybinding for workbench.action.files.saveAll in the 1.7 release to Ctrl+Alt+S for Linux.

{ "key": "ctrl+alt+s",            "command": "workbench.action.files.saveAll" }

For Ubuntu, this is bound to OS command to minimizes the window and VS Code is minimized (not what the user is expecting).

Suggestion: bind Files: SaveAll to chord Ctrl+K S like on Windows.

data.title: Provide shell fallbacks for common patterns used to disable shell

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
See https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9087#issuecomment-257626140

A fallback may make sense when shells like `/bin/false`, `/sbin/nologin`, `/usr/sbin/nologin`, etc. are detected. For the actual fallback probably reading `/etc/shells` and grabbing `/bin/bash` if it exists otherwise using the first (or /bin/sh`) in the list.

data.title: Be able to run code after debugging completes.
data.body:
This is a feature request. 

I am doing an experiment using VSCode around remote debugging. I use SSH port forwarding to connect to remote debugger (as part of preLaunchTask). It works great. However there is currently no way for me to shutdown the SSH after debugging completes. 

It will be great if there are something like 'postDebugTask' where I can run something to clean things up. This seems to be a common scenario for remote debugging.

- VSCode Version: 1.6
- OS Version: Linux/Windows

data.title: Test: watch expressions drag and drop
data.body:
- [x] any os @alexandrudima 

Complexity: 1

As per user request #14125, we now support reordering of watch expresions via drag and drop. Make sure this works as expected - both during a debug session and outside of a debug session.

data.title: VSCode stuck at 'installing' phase while installing plugins.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.10
I simply can't install extensions on VSCode. When I find the desired extension and click Install, the button turns slightly grayish, the text becomes "installing" and its stuck like that forever. It does not freeze or anything, it doesn't install the extension, but I am able to use VSCode fine.
Somehow it did install one extension and I don't think it was visible before restarting it. I opened VSCode to see if it is so again and I saw one of the extensions I was trying to install. The issue *could* be internet connection as its pretty slow but it used to work fine sometime ago - now it just doesn't. I don't know if you'll be able to reproduce this but whatever.
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a freshly installed VSCode
2. Go to the extensions thing on the left sidebar
3. Find your desired extension
4. Click Install
5. Get stuck.

It seems that my internet connection is to blame but seriously, its 7mb/s and not enough?
I swear it used to work a couple of weeks ago

data.title: Make markdown image dimensions configurable using a custom image renderer
data.body:
In the newly introduced syntax extension the width and height of an image
can be given in the image title using following format:
`![image](someimageurl 'caption|height=200, width=100')`.
Both width and height parameters are optional, if they are not given the
width and height attributes remains unset on the image element

This resolves #14803

data.title: Spaces are converted to tabs in html regardless of indentation settings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a folder with one .html file with some indented html content and workspace settings.json (`F1` => `Preferences: Open Workspace Settings`). Define settings like this:
```
{
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.insertSpaces": true,
  "editor.formatOnSave": true,
  "editor.renderWhitespace": "all"
}
```
2. Open the .html file, press `F1` > `Convert Indentation to Spaces` (or do this from the status bar). See that the lines are indented with spaces.
3. Save the file (since `formatOnSave` is set to `true`) or just auto-format it with `Alt+Shift+F`.

Expected result:
The file is indented with 2 spaces.

Actual result:
All spaces are converted to tabs.

![spaces-replaced-with-tabs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10902643/19895747/fe87967a-a062-11e6-89e6-e8ab4856cc41.gif)

data.title: Negation of negative (double negatives) in settings
data.body:
- VSCode: Latest Insider 1.7:
- OS Version: Any

Hi,

Do you think this double negatives in VSCode settings:
`"typescript.disableAutomaticTypeAcquisition": false`


Should be re-worded to positive one like:
`typescript.AutomaticTypeAcquisition": true`
or 
`typescript.EnableAutomaticTypeAcquisition": true`
or 
`typescript.AcquireTypeAutomatically": true`

data.title: Enhancement request: text formatting access in vscode.window.showInformationMessage
data.body:
I'd like the ability to format information messages that my extension shows possibly via markdown. For example, I'd like the following input to be rendered as markdown when the alert is presented to the user:

```
vscode.window.showInformationMessage('Hi. I think *this* is really important.');
```

Just thought I'd see if this makes sense to anyone else. Thanks for your consideration and for your hard work on VS Code!

data.title: Show line content in the breakpoints view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Fixes #14351

Have been experimenting with showing breakpoint source in the debug viewlet. The current design has some limitations:

* How to render the X button on top of the breakpoint filename (currently I just hide the filename)
* What to show when the breakpoint is added on an empty line
* How to make the file label push out the content (tryed using flex but that screws up the checkbox and the actionbar)

@joaomoreno suggestions are very welcome

![breakpoints](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/19888251/cc03e6e8-a02d-11e6-9488-6948c33ae6d0.gif)

data.title: Support a way to set image size in MarkedString
data.body: **User story** As an extension developer, I would like to be able to set image sizes in markdown, So that I can provide nicer images in the hover widget. **Tech. background:** VSCode uses marked as markdown processor. Unfortunately this does not provides a way to set width and height for images out of the box... There is a way to configure a special renderer for it e.g.: ```javascript renderer.image = function(href, title, text) { if (title) { var size = title.split('x'); if (size[1]) { size = 'width=' + size[0] + ' height=' + size[1]; } else { size = 'width=' + size[0]; } } else { size = ''; } return (''); }; ``` This would allow to set image size with a syntax: ``` ![alt](http://img.png "420x420") ``` Perhaps a better syntax would be something similar to the one [jira](https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30476) uses: ``` !projectavatar.png|height=250,width=250! ``` **Based on this a preffered syntax could be:** ``` ![alt](http://img.png|"height=420,width=420") ``` **Relevant issues** https://github.com/chjj/marked/issues/339 https://github.com/chjj/marked/pull/535 **Relevant commits** There is already a PR about this in the marked repo (however it is pending since 2015 Jan.) https://github.com/chjj/marked/pull/535/commits/1a6923a7dba39414e849796f2dd3c5541838cfd8

data.title: Extension Usage Telemetry

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is a feature request for basic extension usage telemetry.

Many platforms show app/extension developers basic statistics such as installs per day, uninstalls per day, daily active users, etc.

If it is done in the core product and made available to developers through the marketplace management dashboard, the data will benefit ALL extension developers while ensuring proper information and protections for users. If extension developers have to do this themselves, they may not all reach an appropriate level of security, anonymization, consent, or user notification.

data.title: Support KeyUp Bindings

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is a feature request to support KeyUp bindings in addition to the current bindings.

Motivation:
Commands that have a show/hide or enable/disable pairing would benefit greatly if they could be toggled  with both a keydown and keyup. For example, "Show Hover" would be a great candidate. Executing "show hover" when the key is down and executing "close hover" on a keyup instead of needing to press escape.

Other good candidates would be Peek Definition, my [dimmer extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=hoovercj.vscode-dimmer), unfold/fold section, etc.

data.title: Add workaround for TS issue: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/11883
data.body: We can workaround this on our end by actively setting the `allowNonTsExtensions` compiler options for `compilerOptionsForInferredProjects`.

data.title: Terminal history is truncated after resizing the window when word wrap setting is being applied
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra v. 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Add "editor.wrappingColumn": 0 in settings.json to apply word-wrap setting by default.
2. Resize the window - make it smaller, then maximize it again.

The terminal history is truncated:

![screenshot 2016-11-01 10 29 42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7524789/19883832/0f0ed646-a01f-11e6-8217-1247b72eb912.png)
